commit_list.message:
update cursor positions when indenting

This change causes cursor(s) to maintain their relative position
in their lines after the (in/out)dent occurs.

The previous behaviour was for the whole line to be selected
if nothing was selected at the start.  This was frustrating
because it does not let you immediately start typing after indenting
a new line.
Added script that implements the genetic alg

commit_list.message: Documented streaming method investigation in README
start_cam_stream.sh takes an arg for the video device to capture from

First working demo of camera stream/display

The demo performs low-latency video streaming
from a camera to an HTTP server via mjpg_streamer.

A python script reads from the local server
and displays the image.

There are also setup instructions in the README.md

This was tested on my desktop with the ELP 2.8mm USB camera
module that I bought from amazon:
http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KA80N9U?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o02_s00

The camera is rated for mjpg 1280x720 @ 60fps
The display client read that it was receiving frames at
about 50fps.

Next steps is to test this on the Odroid to see if this
frame rate will still hold up.
WIP: script to test UDP sending
test script to see if camera is working
script to sync repo to odroid
camera streaming works locally with np.to/from string (faster than pickle)
can stream video over socket using pickle
working server/client classes for sending arbitrary payloads over sockets

colors now shows the camera position

basic-camera refactoring

Code from the basic-camera example has been split into
different classes to allow better code-reuse going forward.

This has created a configurable InputManager for handling input,
a Window class, and the first camera class.
WIP: refactoring camera into its own class/module
basic-camera uses delta frame time for movement
Removing useless duplicate files from samples
basic-camera has a rotating camera now
Copying work over from basic-shaders example

Sample program showing basic shader usage

Shows how to pass both position and color as inputs
to a shader program.

added hello_triangle++ program

It draws a red rectangle and a blue triangle
using two different Vertex Array Objects, Vertex
Array Buffers, and Element Array Buffers.

Draw calls are made by specifying indices of the
VBO to draw from.  The rectangle is made by drawing
two triangles from a single VBO.

working example of rendering a triangle

it is a bit messy and needs to be cleaned
up.  This would include better explanations.
Program to create a basic window

commit_list.message:
fixed "multiple definition" errors when used in multiple files

Did this by adding "inline" keyword to non-template functions.
This gets rid of the "One Definition Rule" that C++ has.

This is necessary for a header-only library where the
declaration and definition of the API is still split between
multiple files.

commit_list.message:
Fixed improper values on Component creation

Includes a regression test for this bug. Description from the test:

The situation is that a component is created with certain values and then deleted.
When a new component of the same type is created it was being assigned to the spot
of the old component without having its new values copied into place.
commit_list.repo_description: A type-safe Entity Component System in C++11 that offers a simple API and scalable performance.

commit_list.message:
fixed test build, fixed bug

bug was that deleting an entity while iterating over
entities would cause an exception to be raised.  This was happening
because all the entities components would be "soft" deleted during iteration
but the entity was actually deleted.  When iteration was over the components
would be deleted for real but they would also try to update the component mask
for the entity they belonged to.

This update wasn't necessary because it was already done during the "soft" delete
but more importantly this caused a crash because that entity no longer had an
entry in the map for it's component mask.

This also includes a regression test for the bug.
commit_list.repo_description: A type-safe Entity Component System in C++11 that offers a simple API and scalable performance.

fix bug when iterating over multiple component types

The "begin" iterator was starting at the beginning of a
component pool instead of advancing itself to the first
component that belonged to an entity which satisfied the
set of components being queried for.

commit_list.message:
Adding boost::signals2 v1.63

This was done by the following:

1. Download main boost zip (ex: http://www.boost.org/users/download/)
2. extract it
3. cd boost_<VERSION>
4. ./bootstrap.sh
5. ./b2 tools/bcp
  - bcp extracts given boost libs + their dependencies
6. mkdir ../signals2
7. ./bin.v2/tools/bcp/gcc-6.2.0/release/link-static/bcp signals2 ../signals2
  - exact location of bcp will obviously vary
  - this extracts the necessary files from all of boost and puts it under ../signals2/
8. cp -r ../signals2/boost <glomerate root dir>/ext/boost
9. cp boost/parameter/aux_/overloads.hpp <glomerate root dir>/ext/boost/parameter/aux_/overloads.hpp
  - this was needed to use boost::signals2 but it wasn't present
10. LICENSE_1_0.txt had to be manually copied over

Added boost license
